message.content:
cs.SD, cs.CL, cs.SD, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

The paper presents a text-to-speech system constructed entirely from deep neural networks, which involves various components such as segmentation model, grapheme-to-phoneme conversion model, phoneme duration prediction model, fundamental frequency prediction model, and audio synthesis model. Therefore, the paper is likely to belong to the following arXiv CS sub-categories: 

- cs.SD (Sound): The paper deals with speech synthesis, which is a subfield of sound processing. 
- cs.CL (Computation and Language): The paper involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques such as grapheme-to-phoneme conversion, which falls under the scope of this sub-category. 
- cs.SD (Signal Processing): The paper deals with processing speech signals, which is a subfield of signal processing. 
- cs.LG (Machine Learning): The paper extensively uses deep neural networks for various components of the text-to-speech system, which falls under the scope of this sub-category. 
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): The paper involves the use of AI techniques such as deep learning for speech synthesis, which falls under the scope of this sub-category.
